rule-18-1-ap.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 50,000 sf, so the baseline system type is system 5.  Thermal Zone 1 has peak internal gains that differ by more than 10 Btu/h.ft2 and is correctly modeled with System type 3.  It is in climate zone CZ4A

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-aq.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 50,000 sf, so the baseline system type is system 5.  Thermal Zone 1 has peak internal gains that differ by more than 10 Btu/h.ft2 and is incorrectly modeled with System type 5.  It is in climate zone CZ4A

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-ar.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 50,000 sf, so the baseline system type is system 6.  Thermal Zone 1 has peak internal gains that differ by more than 10 Btu/h.ft2 and is correctly modeled with System type 4.  It is in climate zone CZ1A

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-as.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 50,000 sf, so the baseline system type is system 6.  Thermal Zone 1 has peak internal gains that differ by more than 10 Btu/h.ft2 and is incorrectly modeled with System type 6.  It is in climate zone CZ1A

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-at.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 20,000 sf.  Thermal Zone 1 is type Laboratory with 16,000 cfm of zone exhaust and HVAC system type 5.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-au.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  Thermal Zone 1 is type Laboratory with 16,000 cfm of zone exhaust and HVAC system type 7.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-av.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  Thermal Zones 1 and 2 are type Laboratory with total 16,000 cfm of zone exhaust and HVAC system type 5.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-aw.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 20,000 sf.  Thermal Zone 1 is type Laboratory with 16,000 cfm of zone exhaust and incorrectly modeled as being on the same System 6 as the rest of the zones.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-ax.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  Thermal Zone 1 is type Laboratory with 12,000 cfm of zone exhaust and is incorrectly modeled with a dedicated HVAC system type 7.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-ay.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  Thermal Zones 1 and 2 are type Laboratory.  They are served by one System 7 with total exhaust rate of 16,000cfm.  Expected result: undetermiend

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-ba.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and one zone with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 500 sf.  Thermal Zones 1 is a stairwell with a heating-only system.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-bb.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and one zone with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 500 sf.  Thermal Zones 1 is a stairwell with a heating-only system.  There is a cooling system in the proposed model.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-bc.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and one zone with HVAC BAT = HEATED_ONLY_STORAGE.  Building area is 20,000 sf.  Thermal Zone 1 is a warehouse with a heating-only system.  Thermal Zones 2,3&4 are office with HVAC Sys-3  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-bd.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and one zone with HVAC BAT = HEATED_ONLY_STORAGE.  Building area is 20,000 sf.  Thermal Zone 1 is a warehouse with a heating-only system.  Thermal Zones 2,3&4 are office.  Only thermal zones 3&4 have HVAC Sys-3.  Thermal Zone 2 is incorrectly modeled with Sys-9 in the baseline despite having a DX coil in the proposed model  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-be.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Predominant HVAC type is System 7.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  Thermal Zone 1 has a lighting space type COMPUTER_ROOM with a peak cooling load greater than 650,000btu/hr and has HVAC system type 11.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-bf.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Predominant HVAC type is System 7.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  Thermal Zone 1 has a lighting space type COMPUTER_ROOM,peak cooling load of 650,000btu/hr and is on the System 7.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-bg.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Predominant HVAC type is System 5.  Building area is 120,000 sf.  Thermal Zone 1 has a lighting space type COMPUTER_ROOM with a peak cooling load greater than 3,000,000btu/hr and has HVAC system type 11.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-bh.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Predominant HVAC type is System 5.  Building area is 120,000 sf.  Thermal Zone 1 has a lighting space type COMPUTER_ROOM with a peak cooling load greater than 3,000,000btu/hr and is incorrectly  modeled as being on the predominant hvac system 5.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-bi.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Predominant HVAC type is System 5.  Building area is 120,000 sf.  Thermal Zone 1 has a lighting space type COMPUTER_ROOM with a peak cooling load less than 3,000,000btu/hr and is modeled as being on the predominant hvac system 5.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-bj.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Predominant HVAC type is System 7.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  Thermal Zone 1 has a lighting space type COMPUTER_ROOM,peak cooling load of less than 650,000btu/hr and has HVAC system type 3.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

Building area is 160,000 sf.  Thermal Zone 1 has a lighting space type COMPUTER_ROOM,peak cooling load of less than 650,000btu/hr and has HVAC system type 3.  Expected result: fail

rule-18-1-bm.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 20,000 sf.  The buidling is modeled with each zone having its own HVAC system type 3.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-bn.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 20,000 sf.  The buidling is modeled incorrectly with all zones being served by one HVAC system type 3.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-bo.test_description: The baseline building is two floors and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  The buidling is modeled with each floor having its own HVAC system type 7.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-1-bp.test_description: The baseline building is two floors and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  The buidling is modeled incorrectly with one HVAC System 7 serving all zones.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: HVAC system type selection is based on ASHRAE 90.1 G3.1.1 (a-h)

rule-18-2-a.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = RESIDENTIAL.  The building is correctly modeled with Separate HVAC System 1 serving each zone.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-b.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = RESIDENTIAL.  The building is incorrectly modeled with multiple zones served by HVAC System 1.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-c.test_description: The baseline building is two floors and four zones in climate zone CZ1A with HVAC BAT = RETAIL.  The building is correctly modeled with one HVAC system 4 serving each zone.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-d.test_description: The baseline building is two floors and four zones in climate zone CZ1A with HVAC BAT = RETAIL.  The building is incorrectly modeled with one HVAC system 4 per floor.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-e.test_description: The baseline building is two floors and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = OTHER_NON_RESIDENTIAL.  The building area is 50,000 sf.  The building is correctly modeled with one HVAC system 5 per floor.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-f.test_description: The baseline building is two floors and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = OTHER_NON_RESIDENTIAL.  The building area is 50,000 sf.  The building is incorrectly modeled with one HVAC system for the whole building.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-g.test_description: The baseline building is two floors and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = OTHER_NON_RESIDENTIAL.  The building area is 50,000 sf.  The building has two laboratory zones with a total lab exhaust rate of 16,000 cfm.  The two exhaust zones are correctly served by one System 5 HVAC system.  The other two zones are each served by a System 5 HVAC system (one per floor).  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-h.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  Thermal Zones 1 and 2 are type Laboratory with total 16,000 cfm of zone exhaust.  Each zone is incorrectly modeled with its own dedicated HVAC system type 7.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-h.1.test_description: The baseline building is two floors and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = OTHER_NON_RESIDENTIAL.  The building area is 50,000 sf.  The building has two laboratory zones with a total lab exhaust rate of 12,000 cfm.  The two exhaust zones are served by one System 5 HVAC system.  The other two zones are each served by a System 5 HVAC system (one per floor).  We expect an undetermined result because with a lab exhaust rate of 12,000 cfm, and 4,000cfm of system exhaust, it is not possible to tell if there is more than 15,000cfm of lab exhaust.  Expected result: undetermined

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-i.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  Thermal Zones 1 and 2 are type Laboratory with total 12,000 cfm of zone exhaust.  The building is modeled with one HVAC system 7 per floor and incorrectly with one HVAC system 7 for the Laboratory zones.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-23-a.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  Thermal Zones 1 and 2 are type Laboratory with total 16,000 cfm of zone exhaust.  Expected result: applicable

standard.rule_description: The lab exhaust fan shall be modeled as constant horsepower (kilowatts) reflecting constant-volume stack discharge with outdoor air bypass in the baseline

rule-18-23-b.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  Thermal Zones 1 and 2 are type Laboratory with total 8,000 cfm of zone exhaust.  Expected result: not applicable

standard.rule_description: The lab exhaust fan shall be modeled as constant horsepower (kilowatts) reflecting constant-volume stack discharge with outdoor air bypass in the baseline

rule-18-23-c.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  Thermal Zones 1 and 2 are NOT type Laboratory with total 16,000 cfm of zone exhaust.  Expected result: not applicable

standard.rule_description: The lab exhaust fan shall be modeled as constant horsepower (kilowatts) reflecting constant-volume stack discharge with outdoor air bypass in the baseline
